author: Staff Reporter
text:
Around Rs. 11.50 lakh cash, induction stoves and solar lamps claimed to have been carried for distribution to self-help groups (SHGs) by the branch of a finance company, called Fullerton India, in Melur were seized by police on Tuesday evening.

Melur police registered a case under Sections 171B and 171E of the Indian Penal Code (for bribery) against Kaja Maideen, senior unit manager of the company.

Police sources said that based on information received by them about the company distributing money and other items, a team of police personnel intercepted the company’s vehicle.

On inspection, the police found Rs. 11.57 lakh, 15 induction stoves, 15 cooking ware sets and 25 solar lamps in the vehicle, they said.

A senior official from Madurai district police said that though the company employees claimed that the cash was meant for distribution as loans to the SHGs, they could not provide any documentary evidence to prove their claim.

The company employees allegedly told the police that the other items were for distribution as gifts to best performing SHGs.

“Even for distribution of loans, they need not carry so much money. Moreover, they could not immediately provide documents to show that they are a recognised Non-Banking Finance Company (NBFC),” the official said.

The cash and other items were seized by Melur police.

Employees claimed the cash was meant for distribution as loans to the SHGs
title: Rs. 11.50 lakh seized from finance company
